p: MR overcomes many limitations of observational studies and RCTs. Since the inheritance of a genetic variant is independent of other traits (Mendelâ€™s law of independent assortment), any confounders should be equally common in people with different genotypes. MR is less susceptible to reverse causation, because genotypes are determined at conception and not modifiable by disease. Thanks to openly available GWAS data, MR is much cheaper and quicker than a large-scale observational study or RCT. There are nonetheless key limitations of MR, which are explained in Box 1.
